page.title: 06Village Trade
page.content: There are two shops in the village, Park Stores, and Saunders. Mr. Saunders has a warehouse which was used for storing grain and corn which arrived by train. The farmers used to collect it from him. There were a few mills where inhabitants used to grind corn which was grown locally. There was a weir and a malt house which is now a farmhouse. Across the road from the shop is an old cottage which still has the original railings around it. Next to Saunders shop is the Post Office run by Mrs. Nichholls.
